bullets.text: U.S. CPI rose 0.3% m/m in September; headline inflation 3.0% y/y, with gasoline driving gains; core pressures continue easing.
Fed proposes greater transparency and public accountability for annual bank stress tests, seeking comment; potential implications for capital planning and market expectations.
Social Security announces 2026 COLA of 2.8%, trailing current price increases, potentially squeezing retirees’ real incomes.
AMD jumps on reports IBM uses its chips for quantum error correction; IBM rallies on quantum progress; Intel highlights improving cash flow and foundry momentum.
Hedge fund assets reach a record $5 trillion as quarterly inflows hit an 18-year high, signaling stronger risk appetite.
U.S. deploys an aircraft carrier to Latin America amid expanded anti-drug operations; sanctions target Colombia’s President Petro, heightening regional tensions.
Beijing adopts conciliatory tone ahead expected Trump–Xi meeting, suggesting potential thaw in trade and geopolitical frictions.
Reliance’s reduced purchases of Russian crude could lift India’s import costs and tighten diesel supplies, reshaping Asian fuel flows.
U.S. new-car prices average $50,000 for the first time, keeping monthly payments high and pressuring auto demand.
EU says Meta and TikTok breached Digital Services Act transparency rules, foreshadowing higher compliance costs and potential fines.
China’s coastal cities are subsiding as seas rise at record pace, amplifying flood risk and threatening infrastructure and property.
Studies report a spark for Parkinson’s pathology and suggest statins may lower dementia risk, indicating new preventive avenues.
